page.title: 02THE DRUMNADROCHIT LANDSCAPE
page.content: The area is situated where two{'U' {shaped valleys},gouged out by ice meet the{Great Glen},another deep glaciated valley (following a fault line). The valley slopes are fairly steep reaching up to{300m}and are either farmed or left under birch or afforested (especially where there are lumps of hard conglomorate rock which form steeper slopes and sentinel hills like{Craigmony}and{Craig Nay}). The higher moorland is used for summer sheep grazing. The flat valley bottom is filled with glacial & alluvial deposits making it very stony. Old raised beaches,marking the original limit of{Loch Ness}ring the valley sides. These areas are farmed and contain the main settlements and transport links,though the flatter marshy areas are covered in alder woods.
